nodes.documentation:
Keeps track of whitelists and can check if sender and reciever are configured to allow a transfer.
Only administrators can update the whitelists.
Any address can only be a member of one whitelist at a time.
nodes.name: Whitelistable

nodes.documentation:
Sets an address's white list ID.  Only administrators should be allowed to update this.
If an address is on an existing whitelist, it will just get updated to the new value (removed from previous).
nodes.name: addToWhitelist

nodes.documentation: Clears out an address's white list ID.  Only administrators should be allowed to update this.
nodes.name: removeFromWhitelist

nodes.documentation:
Sets the flag to indicate whether source whitelist is allowed to send to destination whitelist.
Only administrators should be allowed to update this.
nodes.name: updateOutboundWhitelistEnabled

nodes.documentation:
Determine if the a sender is allowed to send to the receiver.
The source whitelist must be enabled to send to the whitelist where the receive exists.
nodes.name: checkWhitelistAllowed

nodes.documentation:

Only administrators can update the whitelists.
Any address can only be a member of one whitelist at a time.

If an address is on an existing whitelist, it will just get updated to the new value (removed from previous).
nodes.name: addToWhitelist

nodes.name: removeFromWhitelist

nodes.documentation:
Determine if the a sender is allowed to send to the receiver.
The source whitelist must be enabled to send to the whitelist where the receive exists.
nodes.name: checkWhitelistAllowed

isOwner().return: true if `msg.sender` is the owner of the contract.

renounceOwnership().details: Allows the current owner to relinquish control of the contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.

params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

addAdmin(address).notice: Add an admin to the list.  This should only be callable by the owner of the contract.

addToWhitelist(address,uint8).notice: Sets an address's white list ID.  Only administrators should be allowed to update this. If an address is on an existing whitelist, it will just get updated to the new value (removed from previous).

checkWhitelistAllowed(address,address).notice: Determine if the a sender is allowed to send to the receiver. The source whitelist must be enabled to send to the whitelist where the receive exists.

isAdministrator(address).notice: Determine if the message sender is in the administrators list.

removeAdmin(address).notice: Remove an admin from the list.  This should only be callable by the owner of the contract.

removeFromWhitelist(address).notice: Clears out an address's white list ID.  Only administrators should be allowed to update this.

renounceOwnership().notice: Renouncing to ownership will leave the contract without an owner. It will not be possible to call the functions with the `onlyOwner` modifier anymore.

updateOutboundWhitelistEnabled(uint8,uin.notice: Sets the flag to indicate whether source whitelist is allowed to send to destination whitelist. Only administrators should be allowed to update this.

userdoc.notice: Keeps track of whitelists and can check if sender and reciever are configured to allow a transfer. Only administrators can update the whitelists. Any address can only be a member of one whitelist at a time.
